intro: Sida triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered mallows, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems, palmate leaves, and clusters of small, pale pink or white flowers. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in various habitats such as forests and grasslands. Sida triflora is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
